page.title: 07Farming Around Chard
page.content: {Farms}have changed greatly in the past 10 years due to the larger acreage of {cereals} grown,the ravages of{Dutch} {Elm Disease},improvement of access for milk tankers when churn traffic ceased and the general reduction of farm labour. The latter has resulted in many farm cottages being sold to private owners who are retired or work in nearby towns. Productivity has been improved by the use of powerful tractors with power take_off allowing one_man operation. There are{markets}in Taunton,Axminster and Ilminster where bullocks are sold to the local abbatoirs for slaughter. At nearby{Pudleigh}there is a trout farm where fish are reared in a series of ponds to eatable size. Many farms let property for holidays and some are registered{camp sites} charging up to Â£1/person/night.
